display.label: Facebook Marketing
display.description: Interact with ads and adsets in your Facebook Marketing account.

inputs.comments: Provide a valid authURL for Facebook Marketing
inputs.label: Authorize URL

inputs.comments: Provide a valid Facebook Marketing version to complete the Token URL
inputs.label: Token URL

inputs.comments: Provide the App Id that was generated from your Facebook App.
inputs.label: App Id

inputs.comments: Provide the App Secret that was generated from your Facebook App.
inputs.label: App Secret

inputs.comments: Provide a valid list of scopes. A list per use case is provided on the Facebook Marketing docs: https://developers.facebook.com/docs/marketing-api/overview/authorization/
inputs.default: ads_read ads_management pages_show_list groups_access_member_info leads_retrieval page_events pages_read_user_content public_profile
inputs.label: Scopes

documentation.description:
This component uses OAuth 2.0 to connect to Facebook's Marketing API.
To get started with [Facebook Marketing](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/marketing-apis/get-started), you first need to [create a developer account](https://developers.facebook.com/).

1. Select **Create app**, take note of the App Id and App Secret under the basic tab.
1. Navigate to the Facebook Login Section:
    1. You will see an input to enter your Prismatic Redirect URL.
    1. Under the **Valid OAuth Redirect URIs** section add `https://oauth2.prismatic.io/callback` as a **Redirect URI**.
1. Now add a new Facebook Marketing action to your Prismatic integration, and you will see a new connection.
1. Enter the values that you previously saved from your Facebook Developer App.
1. All the scopes you need should already exist in the connection. However if you need to enter additional scopes you can refer to [Facebook Marketing Docs](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/permissions/reference/) to find the correct ones.

Now you can make a new Facebook Marketing connection in Prismatic, and provide the values you obtained earlier.

For any additional setup information, refer to the [Facebook Marketing Docs](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/marketing-apis/overview)

connections.label: Sandbox Ad Account Token
connections.comments: Use this connection to connect to a sandbox ad account.

inputs.comments: A valid sandbox token for Facebook Marketing API
inputs.label: Sandbox Token

documentation.description:
This component may also use the Sandbox Ad token to connect a Facebook Marketing's Sandbox Ad Account
To get started with [Facebook Marketing](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/marketing-apis/get-started), you first need to [create a developer account](https://developers.facebook.com/).

1. Select **Create app**, take note of the App Id and App Secret under the basic tab.
1. Navigate and expand the Marketing API Section and select the Tools section.
    1. In the **Sandbox Ad Account Managment** section, create and name a new Sandbox Ad Account.
    1. Under Actions select the button with a key icon and in the Generate Access Token window Select **Generate**
    1. Add this Access Token to the Sandbox Ad Token Connection Type in Prismatic.
1. All the scopes you need should already exist in the connection. However if you need to enter additional scopes you can refer to [Facebook Marketing Docs](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/permissions/reference/) to find the correct ones.

For any additional setup information, refer to the [Facebook Marketing Docs](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/marketing-apis/overview)

display.label: Raw Request
display.description: Send a raw HTTP request to Facebook Marketing API

inputs.comments: Provide the version of a graphql.
inputs.label: Graph Version

inputs.comments: Input the path only (/accounts), The base URL is already included (https://graph.facebook.com/v<INPUT_VERSION>.0). For example, to connect to https://graph.facebook.com/v<INPUT_VERSION>.0/accounts, only /accounts is entered in this field.
inputs.label: URL

inputs.comments: The HTTP method to use.
inputs.label: Method

inputs.comments: The HTTP body payload to send to the URL.
inputs.label: Data

inputs.comments: The Form Data to be sent as a multipart form upload.
inputs.label: Form Data

inputs.comments: File Data to be sent as a multipart form upload.
inputs.label: File Data

inputs.placeholder: The file name to apply to a file
inputs.comments: File names to apply to the file data inputs. Keys must match the file data keys above.
inputs.label: File Data File Names

inputs.comments: A list of query parameters to send with the request. This is the portion at the end of the URL similar to ?key1=value1&key2=value2.
inputs.label: Query Parameter

inputs.comments: A list of headers to send with the request.
inputs.label: Header

inputs.comments: The type of data you expect in the response. You can request json, text, or binary data.
inputs.label: Response Type

inputs.comments: The maximum time that a client will await a response to its request
inputs.label: Timeout

inputs.comments: Enabling this flag will log out the current request.
inputs.label: Debug Request

inputs.comments: The delay in milliseconds between retries.
inputs.label: Retry Delay (ms)

inputs.comments: If true, retries on all erroneous responses regardless of type.
inputs.label: Retry On All Errors

inputs.comments: The maximum number of retries to attempt.
inputs.label: Max Retry Count

inputs.comments: Specifies whether to use a pre-defined exponential backoff strategy for retries.
inputs.label: Use Exponential Backoff

display.label: Create Ad
display.description: Creates a new ad

inputs.comments: Provide the identifier of an Ad Account. This value can either be an Id, or the name of the account.
inputs.label: Ad Account

inputs.comments: This field is required for create. The ID or creative spec of the ad creative to be used by this ad. You can read more about creatives here. You may supply the ID within an object as follows:
inputs.label: Creative

inputs.comments: Name of the ad.
inputs.label: Name

inputs.comments: The ID of the ad set, required on creation.
inputs.label: Adset Id

inputs.comments: The ad set spec for this ad. When the spec is provided, adset_id field is not required.
inputs.label: Adset Spec

inputs.comments: Indicates the end time for the ad.
inputs.label: Ad Schedule End Time

inputs.comments: Indicates the start time for the ad.
inputs.label: Ad Schedule Start Time

inputs.comments: Ad Labels associated with this campaign
inputs.label: Ad Labels

inputs.comments: The ID of the audience.
inputs.label: Audience Id

inputs.comments: Bid amount for this ad which will be used in auction instead of the ad set bid_amount, if specified. Any updates to the ad set bid_amount will overwrite this value with the new ad set value
inputs.label: Bid Amount

inputs.comments: The domain where conversions happen. Required to create or update an ad in a campaign that shares data with a pixel. This field will be auto-populated for existing ads by inferring from destination URLs . Note that this field should contain only the first and second level domains, and not the full URL. For example facebook.com.
inputs.label: Conversion Domain

inputs.comments: The format of the date.
inputs.label: Date Format

inputs.comments: The sequence of the ad within the same campaign
inputs.label: Display Sequence

inputs.comments: The ID of the draft ad.
inputs.label: Draft Adgroup Id

inputs.comments: Flag to create a new audience based on users who engage with this ad
inputs.label: Engagement Audience

inputs.comments: Include the demolink hashes.
inputs.label: Include Demolink Hashes

inputs.comments: This is set to ACTIVE for meta reward ad.
inputs.label: Meta Reward Adgroup Status

inputs.comments: Priority of the ad.
inputs.label: Priority

inputs.comments: ID of the source Ad, if applicable.
inputs.label: Source Ad Id

inputs.comments: Provide a status for the given ad. During testing, it is recommended to set ads to a PAUSED status so as to not incur accidental spend.
inputs.label: Ad Status

inputs.comments: Provide the version of a graphql.
inputs.label: Graph Version

display.label: Create Campaign
display.description: Creates a new campaign

inputs.comments: Provide the identifier of an Ad Account. This value can either be an Id, or the name of the account.
inputs.label: Ad Account

inputs.comments: special_ad_categories
inputs.label: Special Ad Categories

inputs.comments: special_ad_category_country
inputs.label: Special Ad Category Country

inputs.comments: Name for this campaign
inputs.label: Campaign Name

inputs.comments: Campaign's objective. If it is specified the API will validate that any ads created under the campaign match that objective.
inputs.label: Objective

inputs.comments: Ad Labels associated with this campaign
inputs.label: Ad Labels

inputs.comments: Choose bid strategy for this campaign to suit your specific business goals.
inputs.label: Bid Strategy

inputs.comments: This field will help Facebook make optimizations to delivery, pricing, and limits. All ad sets in this campaign must match the buying type.
inputs.label: Buying Type

inputs.comments: campaign_optimization_type
inputs.label: Campaign Optimization Type

inputs.comments: Daily budget of this campaign. All adsets under this campaign will share this budget. You can either set budget at the campaign level or at the adset level, not both.
inputs.label: Daily Budget

inputs.comments: To create an iOS 14 campaign, enable SKAdNetwork attribution for this campaign.
inputs.label: Is Skadnetwork Attribution

inputs.comments: is_using_l3_schedule
inputs.label: Is Using L3 Schedule

inputs.comments: Array of Iterative Split Test Configs created under this campaign .
inputs.label: Iterative Split Test Configs

inputs.comments: Lifetime budget of this campaign. All adsets under this campaign will share this budget. You can either set budget at the campaign level or at the adset level, not both.
inputs.label: Lifetime Budget

inputs.comments: The object this campaign is promoting across all its ads. It's required for SKAdNetwork or Aggregated Event Measurement campaign creation. Only product_catalog_id is used at the ad set level.
inputs.label: Promoted Object

inputs.comments: Used if a campaign has been copied. The ID from the original campaign that was copied.
inputs.label: Source Campaign Id

inputs.comments: A spend cap for the campaign, such that it will not spend more than this cap. Defined as integer value of subunit in your currency with a minimum value of $100 USD (or approximate local equivalent). Set the value to 922337203685478 to remove the spend cap. Not available for Reach and Frequency or Premium Self Serve campaigns
inputs.label: Spend Cap

inputs.comments: start_time
inputs.label: Start Time

inputs.comments: Only ACTIVE and PAUSED are valid during creation. Other statuses can be used for update. If it is set to PAUSED, its active child objects will be paused and have an effective status CAMPAIGN_PAUSED.
inputs.label: Ad Status

inputs.comments: stop_time
inputs.label: Stop Time

inputs.comments: Topline Id
inputs.label: Topline Id

inputs.comments: Provide the version of a graphql.
inputs.label: Graph Version

display.label: Business Names
display.description: A picklist of business names

inputs.comments: Provide the version of a graphql.
inputs.label: Graph Version

documentation.description:
[Facebook Marketing](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/marketing-apis/get-started) offers digital marketing for a variety of channels for building communication with your audience.
The **Facebook Marketing** component allows you to interact with your ads, adsets, campaigns and more.
